intro: Paliurus aubletia, commonly known as the Aublet's thorny acanthus, is a shrub native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and spiny leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by distinctive seed pods. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of its native region. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
